alert.note: Alert for Dunn; Pepin (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 11:02PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pepin and southern Dunn Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1102 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eau Galle, or 10 miles southwest of Menomonie, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Pepin and southern Dunn Counties, including the following locations... Rock Falls, Caryville, Downsville and Weston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Wisconsin.
